column4: Hi can anyone help me please? I have just installed Ubuntu 10.10 and when I restarted I'm now getting an error saying: no such device 8c35181b-d6d0-476f-a1b2-7503d2915da grub rescue:
replicasex?
it seems that grub isnt pointing to the boot partition. how many hard drives do you have
can you please tell me how to point grub to the boot partition?

i have limited experience in this, but there should be guides on how to perform a grub rescue or edit the startup to point to the correct partition. maybe booting in iwth the live usb stick and then confirming which partition is the boot partition, then writing it down, then booting the system off the hdd while holding shift to modify the grub loadup menu would allow you to get into the system and then modify it permane
thanks for your help, i have tried a few guides on the internet about restoring grub with the livecd but they haven't worked.
ok. what is your partition setup? i will look further
i just need to start the machine up again from the livecd give me a few minutes
did you mean disk utility? i cannot see a Disk Manager
yes, disk utility. it show partitions
it says i have a Recovery partition and a NTFS partition but no linux partitions? Yet I have just finished the Ubuntu installation?
ok, maybe grub wasnt pointed to the right partition
what is the name of the windows partition
its sda2
is the recovery partition sda1 or no designator? and you chose the install side by side option?
yes i chose the side by side install and the recovery partition is sda1

im not sure what happened with grub, but i tend to choose the advanced menu during the install to point grub to install to /dev/sda (the whole disk) and not to a partition like /dev/sda3. maybe that is what happened. it needs to be /dev/sda. can you click on sda3 and then set the flag to "boot"?
there is no sda3 visible?
ok. did you resize the partitions during the install to shrink windows?
yes
and it went through the install process?
did you fix that issue with grub
